ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 3h/week
2 hrs
2 to 3
Very little time outside class is required. Assignments are not difficult and very straightforward.
approximately 3-4 hours
6-8 hours

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: informal and collaborative.
The primary instructor is very good. This is not the case for all invited speakers and other instructors.

The course should be more practical, we should get real training instead of learning what the training entails (psychological first aid, for example). It was nice to have a lot of guest speakers to get different perspectives!I think more events outside of class (observing more drills, taking higher level ICS classes) would teach us a lot more than listening to a lecture every week.
good introductory course. could have been more interactive.

strengths - interesting set of topicsdid change my way of approaching disaster scenaariosweaknesses - many lectures were literally read off powerpoint slidesmore examples of real world scenarios should be usedmany final exam questions (especially multiple choice) were very picky and overly specificjoanne mcgovern should be more involved with the class wherever possible given her real world experiences and practical knowledge
An interesting, broad-based coverage of many aspects of disaster epidemiology.

Strengths: Guest lecturers who really know what they're talking about as they're working in the field of public health and disaster management. The class also had a good solid practical approach to public health management in disasters. The assignments were always relevant, which was great. I also left the course completing work in real-world disaster management systems like ICS.Weaknesses: Because there are no tests during the class you're not really sure what the questions will be like on the final. They were very specific sometimes and that seemed slightly unfair to not have anything to practice from. It would also have been nice for Dr. Durante to have been in class more (even when there was a guest lecturer presenting), but I understood that she was very busy this semester.
Very good course. well taught. classes could be long and boring at times and breaks may need to be introduced.
There were so many guest lecturers that it was really had to keep track of the information and what was important.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Amanda Jean Durante  infromal and collaborative
Instructor: Amanda Jean Durante  Very good teacher.

Instructor: Amanda Jean Durante  It was nice to have many different instructors. Dr. Durante was not very timely in getting assignments back, and included things in the final exam that were not on the study guide! Overall though, she was great when she was lecturing about things she really cared about!
Instructor: Amanda Jean Durante  very good instructor, very understanding of student's requirements.

Instructor: Amanda Jean Durante  strengths - appears to enjoy teachingweaknesses - read off powerpoint slideslectures were very information heavywe never got back our second written assignment; feedback therefore was minimal
Instructor: Amanda Jean Durante  Very good.

Instructor: Amanda Jean Durante  Dr. Durante was good overall. She is an okay lecturer - sometimes her powerpoint slides are pretty unclear when you go back to look at them after class because a lot of them are empty and are just questions. It makes reviewing them difficult. She was good at engaging the class in discussion usually, which was nice. She also created good, practical assignments.
Instructor: Amanda Jean Durante  Dr Durante is a very good instructor.
Instructor: Amanda Jean Durante  Not a very good instructor. She does not seem very motivated to teach.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: informal and collaborative
Easy class, adressing very technics aspects of the management of disaster. If you need to complete your class load with an easy class and still want to learn something, this is a good class.
i would recommend it to anyone interested in the subject.
I probably would not recommend this class unless the student was specifically interested in career directly related to disasters.
An interesting look into public health's role in disasters. Not very difficult or time consuming, but it also seems a little light on content.
Yes I would recommend it to someone else, based on my answer to question 6.
Recommended. Great course for disaster management
This course has the potential of being really good if it had a goof professor.
